intro: Sphaeralcea fendleri f. lobata, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in desert scrub and rocky habitats. Sphaeralcea fendleri f. lobata is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low precipitation, making it a resilient species in its native range.
